hypothesis_content.title: APTOS News-Driven Breakout Fade with Liquidity Grab
hypothesis_content.statement: Following the recent Aptos (APT) +4.5% news-driven move, a breakout to a new 7-day high on below-average volume (< 20-day avg) will be reversed within 48 hours as liquidity is grabbed, providing a short opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low-volume breakouts after news are often traps (liquidity grabs) in neutral/bear regimes, as the news is already priced in and lacks sustained buying pressure. The specific mention of APT's move provides a current test case.
entry_conditions: APT price breaks above its 7-day high
Volume on breakout candle < 20-day average volume for APT
Breakout occurs within 3 days of a positive news headline (e.g., 'Aptos Gains 4.5%')

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces to the 7-day volume-weighted average price (VWAP)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price sustains >2% above the 7-day high for 4 hours

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 60% of such low-volume, news-adjacent breakouts continue higher (>2% beyond breakout) over the next 48 hours instead of fading.
